extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 100 large shrimp, peeled and deveined (about 4 pounds)

title: Coney Island Skewered Shrimp
summary: Coney Island Skewered Shrimp might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 10. One serving contains 208 calories, 37g of protein, and 5g of fat. For $3.72 per serving, this recipe covers 18% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. This recipe from My Recipes requires pepper, parsley, lemon juice, and kosher salt. To use up the lemon juice you could follow this main course with the Lemon Shortbread Cookies with Lemon Icing {A Tribute to Aunt Roxanne} as a dessert. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 53%, which is good. Similar recipes include Coney Island Hot Dogs, Coney Island Iced Tea, and Coney Island Sauce.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Alsace Willm Pinot Gris Reserve. It has 4.4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 16 dollars.

productMatches.title: Alsace Willm Pinot Gris Reserve
productMatches.description: An intense golden color with hints of ocher, the wine has a nose of ripe fruit, quince. In the mouth the attack is both supple and full, with notes of honey and spices. The final perfectly balances sugar and acidity.Pair this wine alongside pan-fried foie gras, grilled or roasted white meats (pork, veal), rabbit, poultry in cream sauce, smoked fish, mushroom dishes such as risotto.

instructions: Preheat broiler.                                                                                                 Combine first 7 ingredients in a large bowl. Add shrimp to bowl; toss to coat. Thread 5 shrimp onto each of 20 (12-inch) wooden skewers. Arrange 10 skewers on a large baking sheet. Broil 3 minutes on one side; carefully turn and broil 2 minutes or until shrimp are done. Place skewers on a serving platter. Repeat procedure with remaining 10 skewers. Serve with lemon halves, if desired.

steps.step: Combine first 7 ingredients in a large bowl.

Add shrimp to bowl; toss to coat. Thread 5 shrimp onto each of 20 (12-inch) wooden skewers. Arrange 10 skewers on a large baking sheet. Broil 3 minutes on one side; carefully turn and broil 2 minutes or until shrimp are done.
Place skewers on a serving platter. Repeat procedure with remaining 10 skewers.
Serve with lemon halves, if desired.
